36453248.review:
[h1][b]Cuestión de perspectiva[/b][/h1]

[b]simian.interface++ es un juego de puzzles en el que nos enfrentaremos a diferentes niveles, cuyos nombres hacen referencia a los archivos de un ordenador.[/b]

[h1]DAME MÁS BANANAS[/h1]
El planteamiento de éstos y su diseño están ejecutados de una forma óptima, ofreciendo en cada prueba una mecánica diferente de superarla. Nuestro objetivo consistirá en unir, generalmente, cuadrados para que se dé como resultado un cuadrado blanco. En otros tendremos que construir patrones. Todo ello será gracias al movimiento del ratón, que manejará las perspectivas en todo momento.

El juego presenta una estética sencilla, con colores vivos y figuras geométricas. La banda sonora es al más puro estilo 8 bits, del mismo palo que los juegos de Game Boy, lo cual le añade un toque bastante inmersivo e hipnótico al título.

[h1]Conclusión[/h1]
Sin duda, el precio que marca el juego lo vale y una vez que superemos los diferentes niveles, siempre nos quedará el modo infinito para jugar en ratos muertos.

Miau miau.

36345218.review: 背景音乐真是充满了魔性，配合游戏无限模式真是停不下来。

35662906.review:
Un curioso y entretenido juego donde supuestamente asumimos el papel de un simio a la hora de resolver ciertos rompecabezas sencillos de reconomiento de patrones y demás. Bastante cortito, no llega ni a la hora de juego (aunque tuve que emplear un poco más repitiendo algunos niveles para tener todos los logros). Incluso tiene cierto desarrollo a modo de sutil historia, que es mejor comprobar por uno mismo.

No está nada mal, yo diría que es otro más que se suma a la lista de juegos ideales para echar un rato bien entretenido.

35441574.review:
Oh wow, now this game is pretty good! It's a minimalistic puzzle game that requires you to move your mouse so that it forms a specific shape. 

[b]Story: ?[/b]
Uh, I'm not sure there is one here but some people say the game uses the monkey to hack into a security system. I'm just here for the colourful lights

[b]Gameplay: 5[/b]
It's a solid puzzle game! It requires X and Y axis movement of your mouse to either form specific shapes, allign the images or change the colours by combining them. It's fun and not that difficult.

[b]Graphics & Optimization: 4[/b]
It's a Unity based game and focuses on minimalistic approach so judging this game by it's grapical prowess is not really fair. While it is charming, the game is bound to cause headacheand nausea in some people due to the brightnb colours and constant moving motion.

[b]Steam Ready: 3[/b]
There's 8 achievements to earn and it's not that difficult nor time consuming so it'll be an easy +1 to 100% completed games. No cards and Steam cloud though.

[b]Value for Money: 5[/b]
DEFINITELY! At $2 this game is a great buy, even with the short campaign. There's also an Infinite Loop mode so you would get more out of your $2.


[h1]VERDICT: AN ECXELLENT 4.25 / 5![/H1]

34688601.review:
Every once in awhile I'll land on a game that blows me away with how much it can do with a simple concept, and today is one of those days. Games like this start out with a gameplay loop that, on its own, should be no more captivating than tiddlywinks but build up something far more worthwhile around it. And it's not a long and engrossing experience that I've just surfaced from, but working through the simple, unique puzzles for the mysterious payoff made simian.interface++ a better gaming experience than many longer or larger titles out there.

The name is actually spot-on this time, as the game is posed as a graphic user interface for monkeys. You play a test subject working through trials of the system, simply following the implied instructions for a curved and yellow reward you know too well. Puzzles come in batches of 10 or so, bookended by login screens and performance readouts. I doubt I need to worry about spoilers here but things start to happen as you work through the game that hint at a larger plot afoot.

Don't come for what little story there is, but rather the experience of seeing it told. While not much happens plot-wise the feel of how it unfolds has a definite charm, situated right between sinister cyberpunk and silly cat pictures. I found myself speeding through the puzzles just to see how ridiculous the next glitchy reveal would be, and I was not disappointed. The presentation helps sell the technicolor madness, particularly the soundtrack which is some incredibly catchy techno that takes loads of inspiration from old NES chiptunes.

I'm four paragraphs in and haven't even touched on the puzzles, which are clever permutations of an old gimmick. Each puzzle places a number of squares or lines or boxes on your screen, which you can move and/or rotate simply by moving your mouse. The goal is to snap them back into place, anything from getting a white square into a square outline to realigning a screenful of plaid. They're simple challenges made surprisingly engrossing by how much fine control you have over the figures. You'll also encounter a wide variety of shapes and patterns to make across the six tiny chapters of the game, and more still in the infinite, timed, and secret modes.

This is the total package in terms of kitschy puzzlers, but a small one at that. I saw everything the game had to offer, secret level included, in just over 30 minutes. The infinite and time attack modes could suck up some more of your time, of course, and I wouldn't be opposed to playing through it again once my memories of the two runs I just did (to unlock the secret mode) fade a bit more. With that caveat in mind, I can happily recommend simian.interface++ to anyone looking for a fresh new take on puzzlers. It's got charm, it's got challenge, and it's got the best kind of weirdness to puzzle through.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/audish#curation]curation page[/url]!

34616470.review: If you're an achievement hunter and you want a game with simple achievements you can get in under an hour casually, this game is perfect. I beat the game with 100% in less than 30 minutes (excluding time spent in the main menu) and this is my first time ever playing, or seeing, this game. Aside from achievements, this game has neat music and simple puzzles, while $2 might be a bit much for a game you can complete in it's entirety in less than 30 minutes, it's still worth it.

33678393.review:
[b][i]simian.interface++[/i] is a series of interesting puzzles, although nearly all of them require little logic-brain-power and are more driven by trial and error.[/b] The game has heart, I'll give it that. This is also a nice little title to get 100% of the achievements, and meanwhile you won't feel disgusted at yourself for paying for achievements because you mildly enjoyed a quirky indie game.

[i]Essentially, all the puzzles are solved by manipulating the mouse to align objects.[/i] The puzzles are short. Unfortunately the best puzzles really only show up in the final optional secret level. That should have been the tutorial level for a more beefy puzzle game.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Cheap, and has that indie heart
+Puzzles are interesting, but require little-to-no thought
+Music is fun
+Nice title to get 100% of achievements
+Infinite mode is a nice addition, but still, the flaw is actually with the puzzles and not so much the overall length

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Too short and puzzles are too easy

[b]Not a bad title at all, but left me wanting more 'puzzle'.[/b]

本遊戲主要是把畫面上的東西組合成看起來適當的圖 (通常是填滿方格或者是排好背景)
不過每一關條件都不一樣，需要自己去找出正確的解題方式。

========

This game is all about form a proper picture with the objects on screen. (like fill the square or align the background)
But each level has different rules, you have to find the solution yourself.

Pro: Creative Gameplay.
Con: Too expensive (it just adds infinite random level and timed challenge based on the "free" original game)

Recommend to BUY, if it has discount. :)

24055086.review:
Cette chose est juste [b]géniale[/b]. Vraiment. Bien que la musique soit un tantinet agressive par moment et que le jeu mette parfois physiquement mal à l'aise, il est juste GENIAL.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=716620285

En premier lieu, le jeu présente un gameplay [u]vraiment[/u] original, des "contrôles" relativement durs à prendre en main. En second lieu, le titre sait utiliser ses composants: que ce soit pour créer un tartan, un tapis ou une superposition de couches de lumières, le titre offre une façon de jouer totalement innovante et hors du commun. De plus, le titre a la chance de jouir d'une bande son pas piquée des hannetons qui complète très bien le côté technologique du jeu.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=716619873

J'introduirai cependant un défaut de taille: la durée de vie du titre et sa capacité à se renouveler: bien que le titre soit innovant, il a une certaine difficulté à se renouveler et ce seront souvent des tableaux de même types qui apparaîtront. De plus, le titre est vraiment court pour peu qu'on soit "bon" ou qu'on ait de la chance à trouver facilement les superpositions. Malgré cet avis, je trouve la durée adaptée au jeu car elle ne permet pas de s'habituer à l'environnement du jeu, ce qui donne un coup d'adrenaline bien venu permettant de ne pas oublier ce jeu et permettant de ne pas s'ennuyer.

Dans tous les cas, ce titre est vraiment une perle très intéressante.

Note: 14.5/20

23965536.review:
A really nice little puzzle game, I smiled all the way through. There was a lot of bewilderment at first but I found that the puzzles suddenly became understandable about half a second before I solved them. Each solved puzzle gives the mental satisfaction of a tricky motor skill achievement.

If I could change anything about it, I would mute some of the colours. it's a brightly coloured game in places, but I am playing before bedtime so I'm just geared to want something a ltttle less loud visually at this moment.

Cute jokes and a clever game. I have only played the linear mode and still have the infinite loop to try. It performed well above my expectations for such a small price and deserves a play.

23878742.review: It's a bit like playing with a Rubik's Cube or Homberman Switch Pitch Ball in the Matrix. This game is really a joy. Great procedural levels and music (?!). Plenty of desktop wallpaper fodder if you're quick the the screenshot hotkey. I love the subtle humor as well. Do yrself a favor and pick up this hidden gem.

23878620.review:
When I’m bored, I do picross puzzles. For me, there’s something soothing about them. A puzzle which while light, you can really sink your teeth into. Once you have finished the puzzle, there is a reward, you’ve made a little picture of a boat, or a church. I enjoy light, fun puzzles that you can do in quick succession.

That is probably why I like this game so much.

[i]simian.interface++[/i] is a puzzle game where you have to align the shapes on the screen just so. As you move the mouse, the view and alignment of the pieces change until you find “the spot” and complete the level. To quote the steam page,  “[i]simian.interface++[/i] presents challenges that must be solved using pattern recognition, intuition, and experimentation. “ Because I cannot say it any better myself. 

The concept itself is fluid and intuitive enough that you pick it up straight away. Even the mind chipped monkey you play as can do it. Some of the puzzles can come off as slightly finicky, but never truly frustrating. The only annoyance I saw was the large and distracting “FOCUS LOST” text flashes that up on the screen if you dare to move the cursor too far towards the sidelines. I am not sure why this is needed, if the focus is still on the game window it is probably fair to say we are still playing the game. We can abstract that we have gone wrong by the fact that the pieces are no longer moving on screen.

While the story mode is interesting enough in itself, it is over and done with in roughly 20 minutes. The real replay value is found in the infinite_loop mode where new levels are procedurally generated* for your pleasure. You can casually play through levels to your hearts content. If you long for the immortal glory of leaderboards and a sense of progress, timed_evaluation challenges you to beat as many random levels as you can in a minute. Any chill this game may have is thrown out the window here as you frantically panic about the screen, finding the desired pattern before the time runs out.

The presentation of the whole product is very appealing; [i]simian.interface++[/i] is very minimalistic in its aesthetic. The simplification down to bold block colours and sharp shapes regularly lead to some very interesting patterns. Note! Put together a excellent chiptune soundtrack for simian.interface++ that is very enjoyable to listen to in its own right and really adds to the experience.

[i]simian.interface++[/i] is a unique puzzle game that is both at home being something you can play absentmindedly on infinite_loop mode or trying to beat your personal best on timed_evaluation mode. The story mode is somewhat lacking, but I would argue it is not the main attraction here. If you played the original [i]simian.interface[/i] years ago and feel you’ve seen it all already then it’s more of the same, make of that what you will. The only additions from the original are the infinite_loop and timed_evaluation modes, which are still very welcome insertions. For the people seeing it for the first time, however, you are in for a treat.

It also makes cracking wallpapers if you are quick enough with the screenshot key.

*Procedurally generated is probably in some drinking game somewhere. Take a shot.

23878185.review:
This [strike]game[/strike] [strike]experience[/strike] [i]experiment[/i] is well worth your time and money.  I wrote a [url=http://morestufflike.com/reviews/simian-interface-review-a-game-of-spatial-reasoning/] review [/url] that you can read if you want, but here's the skinny:

[list]
Pros
[*]Smart, innovative gameplay
[*]Cat
[*]Various fruits as rewards - can't beat that
[*]Cheap as hell
[*]'infinite_loop' mode

Cons
[*]Could use more challenging gameplay
[*]I wish it was longer, but I understand why it isn't

Overall:  Get the game.  It's well worth the change.

23874906.review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9XuWQVXqRYU

I have to say I'm surprised at this game.

Its a simple puzzle game  but it plays very smoothly and requires a gentle hand to hit the sweet spot needed to complete. You use the mouse or keyboard to move shapes/colors around to complete a form of jigsaw

Yes its a simple web game that was free in a more simplistic form but for the price I still recommend it as there is something very gratifying about completing the puzzles.
Graphics are clean and the music is quite nice if you like electronica.

Its cheap and although simple certainly would not be a bad thing for a small child as it builds motor skills along with pastern/color recognition.

It gets two thumbs up from me...if only I knew what the cat was all about

23852534.review:
Отзывов нет, а между тем это крайне занимательная и интересная головоломка-паззл. Да, ничего особо сложного нет, но чувство удовлетворения, когда складываешь очередной квадратик, присутствует. И да, тут есть КОТ.

Итого:
+ бесконечные уровни разной степени сложности
+ стоит копейки
+ "MEOW MODE" присутствует

- после часа игры начинает рябить в глазах и болит рука

Для убийства времени вполне достойно, рекомендую.
